title: East Wilkes High School
text:
East Wilkes High School is a class 1A <a href="state%20school">public</a> <a href="high%20school">high school</a> (grades 9–12) located in <a href="Ronda%2C%20North%20Carolina">Ronda, North Carolina</a>. It is a part of the <a href="Wilkes%20County%20Schools%20%28North%20Carolina%29">Wilkes County Schools</a> system. The school's enrollment typically runs from 500 to 600 students. The school serves the East District of Wilkes County, including the town of <a href="Ronda%2C%20North%20Carolina">Ronda</a>, the communities of Roaring River and Clingman, and portions of <a href="Elkin%2C%20North%20Carolina">Elkin</a>.
The original buildings once housed Ronda Elementary School, but were later converted into a high school after the consolidation of the Wilkes County School system in the 1950s resulted in the construction of several new schools in the area. A new academic building and cafeteria have been completed, while the new vocational building remains under construction.
Academics.
The school offers <a href="Vocational%20education">career preparation</a> classes and <a href="University-preparatory%20school">college preparation</a> classes. It offers honors-level <a href="mathematics">mathematics</a>, <a href="English%20studies">English</a>, <a href="history">history</a>, and <a href="science">science</a> courses. East Wilkes also offers <a href="Advanced%20Placement">Advanced Placement</a> courses for juniors and seniors, including <a href="AP%20English%20Language%20and%20Composition">AP English Language and Composition</a>, <a href="AP%20English%20Literature%20and%20Composition">AP English Literature and Composition</a>, <a href="AP%20United%20States%20History">AP United States History</a>, and <a href="AP%20Calculus">AP Calculus</a>. The language department offers courses in <a href="Spanish%20language">Spanish</a> and <a href="Latin">Latin</a>. East Wilkes is fully accredited by the <a href="Southern%20Association%20of%20Colleges%20and%20Schools">Southern Association of Colleges and Schools</a>, also known as SACS.
Athletics.
East Wilkes High School supports <a href="varsity%20team">varsity team</a>s for the following sports: men's/women's <a href="basketball">basketball</a>, <a href="American%20football">football</a>, men's <a href="baseball">baseball</a>, <a href="wrestling">wrestling</a>, women's <a href="softball">softball</a>, women's <a href="volleyball">volleyball</a>, men's/women's <a href="soccer">soccer</a>, men's/women's <a href="tennis">tennis</a>, <a href="cross%20country%20running">cross country</a>, <a href="track%20and%20field">track and field</a>, <a href="cheerleading">cheerleading</a>, and <a href="golf">golf</a>. The school's mascot is the <a href="Cardinal%20%28bird%29">Cardinal</a>. The school's colors are white, red, and black.
East Wilkes competes in the Northwest 1A Athletic Conference as part of the <a href="North%20Carolina%20High%20School%20Athletic%20Association">North Carolina High School Athletic Association</a>.
